intro: Crepis leiosperma, commonly known as the smoothhead mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish, appearing in clusters. Crepis leiosperma is often found in disturbed habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
